title: BNSF Railway
summary: BNSF Railway (reporting mark BNSF) is the largest freight railroad network in North America. One of nine North American Class I railroads, BNSF has 41,000 employees,[1] 32,500 miles (52,300 km) of track in 28 states, and more than 8,000 locomotives.[2] It has three transcontinental routes that provide rail connections between the western and eastern United States. BNSF trains traveled over 169 million miles (272 million kilometers) in 2010, more than any other North American railroad.[3]
